name: Living Iron Statue
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak
conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Immutable Form
text: The statue is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

action.name: Multiattack
text: The statue makes two attacks: one with its blade and one with its hammer.

action.name: Blade
text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Hammer
text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is knocked prone.

action.name: Whirl (Recharge 5-6)
text: The statue can use its action to spin at the waist, targeting creatures of its choice within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 19 (3d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

description:
This squat, solid-looking statue, currently guarding the evil cult's treasure in Isle of the Abbey, is made from pure iron. Its hands are shaped into deadly weapons.
Source: Ghosts of Saltmarsh p. 241
